word_mean: 标准化，规范化：使符合标准或与标准比较

sentence.Network_en: As the world becomes more complex, some things do, of course, standardize and globalize.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着世界变得日益复杂，某些事物确实理所当然地规范化和全球化了。

sentence.Network_en: We will extend and standardize legal services and provide effective legal aid.
sentence.Network_cn: 拓展和规范法律服务,积极开展法律援助.

sentence.Network_en: Efforts to standardize English spellings have not been completely successful.
sentence.Network_cn: 将英语拼写标准化的努力并不完全成功.

entry.def: To standardize things means to change them so that they all have the same features.

example.ex: There is a drive both to standardise components and to reduce the number of models on offer...
example.tran: 正在为实现零部件标准化和减少推出的型号数量而努力。

example.ex: He feels standardized education does not benefit those children who are either below or above average intelligence.
example.tran: 他认为标准化教育对那些智力水平低于或超出平均水平的儿童没有好处。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to conform to standard or norm;
2. evaluate by comparing with a standard

auth_sentence.content: To standardize the price of petrol at some artificially high value.
auth_sentence.res_content: To standardize the price of petrol at some artificially high value.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To standardize the price of petrol at some artificially high value.

auth_sentence.content: The Bluetooth SIG supports the industry's move to standardize on Bluetooth technology in 3D glasses.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Bluetooth SIG supports the industry's move to standardize on Bluetooth technology in 3D glasses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Bluetooth SIG supports the industry's move to standardize on Bluetooth technology in 3D glasses.

auth_sentence.content: Likewise, earnings multiples are often difficult to standardize due to the variable accounting practices across companies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Likewise, earnings multiples are often difficult to standardize due to the variable accounting practices across companies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Likewise, earnings multiples are often difficult to standardize due to the variable accounting practices across companies.

stems_affixes.word_buile: stagn=stan站,立+ant……的→站着不走,停滞的
stand确立+ard→n. 标准, 规格 adj.标准的
stead=stand[v.站, 立, 站起]+fast→稳固的
dis分开+stance=stan站,立→分开站着→有距离→距离
equi平等+distance[n.距离, 远离]→n.等距离
home家+stead=stand[v.站, 立, 站起]→站再家里的→处在家的→家园,家宅
in内+stan站,立+ce→站在里面的东西,表示就在面前→例子
stand确立+ard→n. 标准, 规格 adj.标准的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 站立, 身分, 名望, 持续

stand[v.站, 立, 站起]+point点→n.立场, 观点

stan站,立+d→v.站, 立, 站起

Sentence.sentence: Moreover they site several advantages: alleviation of school overcrowding, strengthen family relationships, lower dropout rates, the facts that students are allowed to learn at their own rate, increased motivation, higher standardized test scores, and reduced discipline problems.

In a study analyzing data on thousands of Ohio State freshmen who lived in dorms, he found that black freshmen who came to college with high standardized test scores earned better grades if they had a white roommate — even if the roommate's test scores were low.
Students who scored low standardized tests

sentences.en: Efforts to sandardize English spellings have not been successful.
sentences.cn: 英语拼写标准化的努力并不成功。
